items.content_html:
Fixes #37268

The example assumed that the CSS it needs to fetch is the second in the page, but the example is rendered in a constructed frame where the example style is the first style definition (or 0th in array).

This fixes the example to work. Note that the first commit is pure layout/template update changes. Only the second commit needs to be reviewed for this.
items.title: Csssytledeclaration setproperty example

Release notes

Sourced from @​mdn/yari's releases.

v4.0.0

4.0.0 (2024-12-19)

⚠ BREAKING CHANGES

  • rari: rari is used by default use :legacy commands for yari

Features

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it

items.content_html:
The Breadcrumb Glossary page notes

Note: While there's no dedicated semantic HTML element for breadcrumb navigation menus, the <ol> element is commonly used to represent their hierarchical structure.

Description

I suggest following our own advice. From a semantically standpoint, it just makes to use an ordered list. This tiny PR replaces the <ul> to a <ol>.

Motivation

From a semantic point of view, it makes sense to switch to an ordered list.
items.title: Switch to `<ol>` for breadcrumb

items.content_html:
Description

The round keyword is not valid in the rect() function. As a result, the demo CSS code provided here doesn't really work. Therefore, I've omitted the round part for the rect() function to ensure proper functionality.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: rect() function does not support the round keyword

before: if height and width is set
after: if height or width is set

Description

moz-force-broken-image-icon specified, that alt text will nto be shown if height and width is set. Changed it to an or.
And reworded sentence to make it simpler to read; converted alt to alt.

Motivation

without any height or width => no alt text:

with both height and width => alt text:

from the original description, the following either or cases, shouldn't display alt text, but they do:

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

items.content_html:
Description

Chrome 132 supports the anchor-size() function on inset (e.g. inset, top, bottom, and logical equivalents) and margin (e.g. margin, margin-top, margin-left, and logical equivalents) properties.

This PR:

  • Updates the CSS anchor-positioning module landing page to mention the new properties that now qualify as "related concepts".
  • Adds a new section to the CSS anchor positioning "Using" guide to describe the new support, mention possible use cases for it, and provide a live example.
  • Adds syntax examples and description for anchor-size() as required to each inset and margin property page.
  • Updates the anchor-size()page with syntax examples and up-to-date description.

Motivation

Additional details

See https://chromestatus.com/feature/5203950077476864 for the data source.

I've also tested anchor-size() in all the different inset and margin properties, with varying combinations of arguments (including <anchor-name>, <anchor-size>, and fallback <length-percentage> values) and as part of calc() expressions, in Chrome 132/133. They seemed to work as expected, and I didn't notice any bugs or support weirdness.

Related issues and pull requests

Related BCD update: mdn/browser-compat-data#25443
items.title: anchor-size() support in inset and margin property values

items.content_html:
Description

After the main MDN CSP guide was updated to follow accepted advice from elsewhere (such as OWASP and Google), it became clear that our practical CSP guide (which is referenced by the HTTP Observatory tool) also needing updating to be consistent with this advice.

This PR attempts to do that. We need to be careful before merging that this is not only correct but also gels with the reports returned by Observatory and Mozilla's sec team.

Also alerting @mozfreddyb and @argl to this PR.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update CSP practical guide for consistency
